info.author: James Mensch
classifiers: Topic :: System :: Systems Administration :: Authentication/Directory :: LDAP
info.description:
pyad_auth
=========
Simple Python library to verify a user's credentials against Active Directory

Requirements
============

* Python >= 2 
* ldap3

Installation
============

* pip install pyad_auth


Usage
=====

* Include pyad_auth in your project
* Use pyad_auth.connect() to connect to the server::

    try:
        server = pyad_auth.connect("myip", port)
    except Exception as e:
        # handle exception
* Use pyad_auth.auth() to verify if the user is in Active Directory::

    try:
        authenticated = pyad_auth.auth(server, "username", "password")
    except Exception as e:
        # handle exception
info.keywords: python microsoft windows active directory AD adsi
info.name: pyad_auth
info.summary: A simple Active Directory user authorization tool.
info.html_description:
pyad_auth

Simple Python library to verify a user’s credentials against Active Directory

Requirements

  • Python >= 2
  • ldap3

Installation

  • pip install pyad_auth

Usage

  • Include pyad_auth in your project

  • Use pyad_auth.connect() to connect to the server:

    try:
    server = pyad_auth.connect("myip", port)
except Exception as e:
    # handle exception

  • Use pyad_auth.auth() to verify if the user is in Active Directory:

    try:
    authenticated = pyad_auth.auth(server, "username", "password")
except Exception as e:
    # handle exception
